intro: Conyza tenella, commonly known as horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Horseweed is known for its ability to produce a large number of small seeds, which allows it to spread easily and thrive in various environments.
